Vedanta and modern Quantum Mechanics describe the same subject\u2014ultimate reality\u2014from opposite points of view and perspective. Vedanta says that we live in a time obstructed world using 5 narrow band senses -- and also a timeless realm in the quantum dimension, where what you see is NOT what you get.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">It was written down in the Vedas said 7000 years ago that mind is over matter. Quantum physicists were shocked at the results of the double slit experiment, which proved that our ancient maharishi seers were right.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The intuition of Indian mystics led them to understand the multidimensional reality and of space-time continuum which is the basis of the modern theory of relativity.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">While modern mathematics, science and technology centre around linear dimensional reality , but the Vedic systems avail multidimensional spiraling reality.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The timeless principles of Vedanta is expressed in the technical language of Quantum Mechanics and the philosophy of science, even today with little or no attenuation of meaning.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Vedas are NOT about Indra running around like a jack ass looking for lost cows and then doing a sacrifice so that he can get the strength to screw the asuras...as told by BR Ambedkar and EVR Periyar.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Heisenberg's uncertainty principle, is an equation of maya.</span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\">Ideas of quantum physics do not seem so crazy if we read Indian philosophy\u2014W Heisenberg ( German physicist )</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">WHEN THEY LEARNT THAT MODERN SCIENCE IN ENTABGLED WITH VEDAS PASSED ON ORAL ROUTE FOR 330 CENTURIES AND PENNED DOWN 70 CENTURUES AGO, THEY ALL CONVERTED TO HINDUISM, THREW AWAY THEIR BIBLES, PICKED UP BHAGAWAD GITA AND WROTE IN THEIR WILLS THAT THEY WANT TO BE CREMATED ( NOT BURIED )</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/11/rip-impossible-with-burial-world-is.html</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-size: large;\">VEDIC SRUTIS HAVE GOLDEN MEAN (1.618 ) , FIBONACCI SERIES , PASCALS TRIANGLE, LUCAS NUMBERS , SRI YANTRA ( GEOMETRY OF OM ), ULAM SPIRAL, PRIME NUMBER MAGIC EMBEDDED IN IT \u2013</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Capt ajit vadakayil</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">..</span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">TO BE CONTINUED-</span></b><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NFGiXhnDQAw/WMvLYFEIKQI/AAAAAAABRuY/cnRzIgLNyfASNbnmdw_9wZelibtOaWQvgCLcB/s1600/IMG-20170316-WA0002%2B%25283%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NFGiXhnDQAw/WMvLYFEIKQI/AAAAAAABRuY/cnRzIgLNyfASNbnmdw_9wZelibtOaWQvgCLcB/s640/IMG-20170316-WA0002%2B%25283%2529.jpg\" width=\"428\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "49", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/3054703017106636561/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "2297561729558934248", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2017-03-16T11:44:00+05:30", "updated": "2017-12-18T23:35:37+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNTEzNjIwMzM3NDU1Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_16.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/2297561729558934248", "title": "SHELL COMPANIES for money laundering, tax evasion, hiding kickbacks, layering PART 17 -- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 16, BELOW--</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_11.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_11.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE ASK MODI TO TRAIN A\nNEW DEPT FOR FINANCIAL FRAUD DONE BY SHELL COMPANIES AND OFFSHORE MONEY\nLAUNDERING<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THEY CAN PICK UP MASALA\nFROM THIS BLOGPOST<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PAY THESE PEOPLE WELL ,\nSO THAT THEY DON\u2019T FALL PREY TO BRIBES<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MAKE SURE THEY\nHAVE&nbsp; DETERMINATION TO START AND JOB AND\nTHE COMPLETE IT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE INCOME TAX DEPT (\nAS OF NOW ) DO NOT HAVE THE WHEREWITHAL TO UNDERSTAND THE DEEP UNDERCURRENTS OF\nSHELL COMPANY MONEY LAUNDERING<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/i-t-department-selective-while-taking-on-shell-cos-cag/articleshow/57660340.cms</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHY HAS THE GOVT OF\nINDIA NOT TAKEN ACTION AGAINST INDIAN BANKS FOR GIVING OUT HUGE LOANS TO SHADY\nBUSINESS PEOPLE?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EXAMPLE?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zoom Developers, with\nan exposure of Rs 3000 crore, Winsome Diamonds, with an exposure of Rs 4,600\ncrore, Forever Precious Diamonds and Jewellery (Rs 2,121 crore), Kolkata-based\nbasmati rice exporter REI Agro (Rs 4,000 crore), &nbsp;Deccan Chronicle (Rs 5,000 crore)etc..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the\nFinance Ministry data, the NPAs of the country's largest lender State Bank of\nIndia is Rs 97,356 crore, followed by Rs 54,640 crore of Punjab National Bank\nand Rs 44,040 crore of Bank of India..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Non-performing asset (NPA) is defined\nas a credit facility in respect of which the interest and/or installment of\nBond finance principal has remained 'past due' for a specified period of time.\nNPA is used by financial institutions that refer to loans that are in jeopardy\nof default. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the last one to two\nyears, NPAs in PSBs have increased rapidly, and now touch a perilous 6-lakh\ncrore mark. Many banks are grappling with the issue of insufficient capital to\nabsorb sudden losses on account of increase in bad loan provisioning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.financialexpress.com/india-news/banking-finance/demonetisation-impact-bank-npas-mount-to-rs-614872-crore-set-to-rise-further/558916/\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.financialexpress.com/india-news/banking-finance/demonetisation-impact-bank-npas-mount-to-rs-614872-crore-set-to-rise-further/558916/</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Concerns arise of\npromoters using shell entities to buy back assets seized by banks at much lower\nprices.. The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has warned banks to be cautious about\nthe entities to which they sell assets acquired on account of loan defaults..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According\nto SDR rules, banks can convert loans to a majority equity stake in the\nborrower and find a buyer within 18 months. The rules further stipulated that\nbanks would have to establish that the buyer does not belong to the existing\npromoter group.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RBI has now\nre-emphasized this point to bankers and asked them to ensure there are no\nback-door connections between the existing promoters and the buyers<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The key aspect of a\nbank\u2019s capital is its ability to absorb losses in the normal course of\noperations. While it is true that much of the bank\u2019s activities are funded by\ndeposits, these have to be repaid at a future date.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-jwlvEsADQRI/WMo2bguWfiI/AAAAAAABRs0/V33gskOtaWMrghcY4wpwmXi1PUE07XSyACLcB/s1600/main-qimg-3cdeeeDD5121027cf73acb6d910bf1ffe3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"352\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-jwlvEsADQRI/WMo2bguWfiI/AAAAAAABRs0/V33gskOtaWMrghcY4wpwmXi1PUE07XSyACLcB/s640/main-qimg-3cdeeeDD5121027cf73acb6d910bf1ffe3.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hence if a bank\u2019s fund base\nonly consists of such borrowed funds (no capital), then in case of a loss on\naccount of defaults by its borrowers, it would not be able to honour the\ndemands from its depositors.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Regulatory efforts around Capital Adequacy Ratio\n(CAR) ensures that banks fund risk-weighted assets with at least a certain\namount of capital. Capital Adequacy Ratio (CAR), also known as Capital to Risk\n(Weighted) Assets Ratio (CRAR), is the ratio of a bank's capital to its risk.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4AVgqyadJRA/WMo4KyztC2I/AAAAAAABRtM/QvW_tCfuOfsQQHBOsgJ6yJtrOSZHY6SbgCLcB/s1600/basel-Dnorms-6-728.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4AVgqyadJRA/WMo4KyztC2I/AAAAAAABRtM/QvW_tCfuOfsQQHBOsgJ6yJtrOSZHY6SbgCLcB/s640/basel-Dnorms-6-728.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">National regulators track a bank's CAR to ensure that it can absorb a\nreasonable amount of loss and complies with statutory Capital requirements. It\nis a measure of a bank's capital. It is expressed as a percentage of a bank's\nrisk weighted credit exposures.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-avoYJ7pfEII/WMo2MBWR0sI/AAAAAAABRsw/d13xtiyTHSANypqvXSM0EX7RPE13hwwzQCLcB/s1600/dowSSnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"244\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-avoYJ7pfEII/WMo2MBWR0sI/AAAAAAABRsw/d13xtiyTHSANypqvXSM0EX7RPE13hwwzQCLcB/s640/dowSSnload.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\nratio is used to protect depositors and promote stability and efficiency of\nfinancial systems around the world.&nbsp; Two\ntypes of capital are measured: tier one capital, which can absorb losses\nwithout a bank being required to cease trading, and tier two capital, which can\nabsorb losses in the event of a winding-up and so provides a lesser degree of\nprotection to depositors.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Also known as capital-to-risk weighted assets ratio\n(CRAR), it is used to protect depositors and promote the stability and\nefficiency of financial systems around the world. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Basel III (or the Third\nBasel Accord) is a global, voluntary regulatory framework on bank capital\nadequacy, stress testing, and market liquidity risk. Basel III is an\ninternational regulatory accord that introduced a set of reforms designed to\nimprove the regulation, supervision and risk management within the banking\nsector.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NaBelvzdQX4/WMo2oNSzqnI/AAAAAAABRs4/guy4rv7O9iwMRC_M1f6Dih50FczP9pkLwCLcB/s1600/basel-iii-and-its-impDact-on-banking-system-in-india-22-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NaBelvzdQX4/WMo2oNSzqnI/AAAAAAABRs4/guy4rv7O9iwMRC_M1f6Dih50FczP9pkLwCLcB/s640/basel-iii-and-its-impDact-on-banking-system-in-india-22-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision published the first version\nof Basel III in late 2009, giving banks approximately three years to satisfy\nall requirements. Largely in response to the credit crisis, banks are required\nto maintain proper leverage ratios and meet certain minimum capital\nrequirements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rising tide of\nnon-performing assets (NPAs) has been one of the major factors affecting Indian\nbanks\u2019 profitability.&nbsp; By March 31, 2019,\nall banks will have to implement a set of new norms set by the\nSwitzerland-based Basel Committee for Banking Supervision.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Given the state of\nthe balance sheets of many public sector banks (particularly the smaller,\nweaker ones), it is doubtful if they will be able to meet the Basel III norms.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the Basel Committee makes a virtue of the fact that the guidelines are\nvoluntary, central banks are free to impose penalties, from fines to removal of\nlicence, on individual banks that do not follow the rules. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most central banks\nallow banks some leeway in terms of deadline extensions (the Reserve Bank of\nIndia has already extended the deadline by a year for Indian banks), but\noverall, they are keen that the Basel norms be adopted as a preventative\nmeasure<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The shadow of the U.S.\nsubprime crisis still looms large over the world of finance.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-erwJ-oMkV4s/WMo21JqGMpI/AAAAAAABRs8/lZwsqdCMmTwe4LiPL2SZyWAQ-2KQGdmiwCLcB/s1600/basel-iii-anFFd-its-impact-on-banking-system-in-india-13-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-erwJ-oMkV4s/WMo21JqGMpI/AAAAAAABRs8/lZwsqdCMmTwe4LiPL2SZyWAQ-2KQGdmiwCLcB/s640/basel-iii-anFFd-its-impact-on-banking-system-in-india-13-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Basel III norms\nhave been designed to absorb shocks arising from financial and economic risks,\nthus reducing the risk of a spillover from the financial sector into the real economy.\nThe basic idea of these guidelines is that banks need to shore up their capital\nduring good times, and not be caught unawares when the tide turns.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QM5l2N03isg/WMo3YLDv4gI/AAAAAAABRtE/A3-tqXIUPuI9mRISFdbi8Mw23B_d9955QCLcB/s1600/b-12D-2-5-3-001.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QM5l2N03isg/WMo3YLDv4gI/AAAAAAABRtE/A3-tqXIUPuI9mRISFdbi8Mw23B_d9955QCLcB/s1600/b-12D-2-5-3-001.jpeg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Reserve Bank\nestimates that banks will need an additional Rs 5 lakh crore to become fully\nBasel III compliant\u2014Rs 3.25 lakh crore in bonds and other instruments, and 1.75\nlakh crore in equity infusion. Of the Rs 1.75 lakh crore, public sector banks\nalone will require at least Rs 1.4 lakh crore.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WYUArBW5q4Y/WMo4jNTqzrI/AAAAAAABRtU/3uGHZIwYKpoDTwZsK7cuLSbMCFWPtwexwCLcB/s1600/050412_2C7.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"368\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WYUArBW5q4Y/WMo4jNTqzrI/AAAAAAABRtU/3uGHZIwYKpoDTwZsK7cuLSbMCFWPtwexwCLcB/s640/050412_2C7.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HAVING SAID ALL ABOVE \u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">PM MODI , PLEASE\nREMEMBER<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">INDIA MUST NOW LEAD THE\nWORLD \u2013 IF WE HAVE TO BE THIS PLANETs NO 1 SUPERPOWER IN 16 YEARS .<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">WE ARE AN INDEPENDENT\nSOVERIGN NATION AND WE SHALL NOT BE PUSHED AROUND BY BASEL THREE ( ZIONIST JEWS\n) -- OR FOR THE MATTER &nbsp;PHASSEL THREE--- OR\nWHATEVER</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The former chairman of\nAxis Bank, P.J. Nayak, called for the setting up of a Bank Investment Company\n(BIC) under the Companies Act, 2013. The RBI appointed Nayak Committee with the\nmain responsibility of making recommendations about the working of bank boards\nand suggest corrective measures .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Formation of BIC: The\nGovernment should set up a Bank Investment Company (BIC) to hold equity stakes\nin banks which are presently held by the Government. The BIC would be\nconstituted as a core investment company under RBI registration and regulation,\nand its business would be like that of a passive sovereign wealth fund for the\nGovernment's banks.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Government and BIC should sign a shareholder agreement\nwhich assures BIC of its autonomy and sets its objective in terms of financial\nreturns from the banks it controls. BIC in future will appoint directors to the\nboards of PSBs according to merit.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nearly 36% of the total\nRs 2.67 lakh crore of NPAs have been created by six sectors\u2014infrastructure,\nmetals, textiles, chemicals, engineering, and mining.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All Indian PSU banks,\nincluding SBI, PNB, BoB and BoI, have stakes in various businesses, which fall\noutside their core areas. The finance ministry has asked state-owned banks to\nprepare a list of their non-core assets and sell them off at an opportune time.\nThe move would help lenders raise capital and allow them to focus on their core\nbusinesses<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By selling off these\nstakes, banks can raise much-needed money to bolster their capital bases to\ncomply with Basel-III guidelines<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dzSZJcs5c1k/WMo2CIjcnSI/AAAAAAABRss/p_Zj0tqv-6cj4F6JRhmbw1fdOpkv93ahwCLcB/s1600/main-SSqimg-3637a36233e76f26b626f20667863d30.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"258\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dzSZJcs5c1k/WMo2CIjcnSI/AAAAAAABRss/p_Zj0tqv-6cj4F6JRhmbw1fdOpkv93ahwCLcB/s640/main-SSqimg-3637a36233e76f26b626f20667863d30.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, SBI has\nsubsidiaries like SBI Insurance Company, SBI Dfhi, NSE and many other\ncompanies. Similarly, PNB has stakes in PNB Housing, PNB Gilts and UTI Asset\nManagement, among others. Bank of Baroda and Bank of India too have stakes in\nmany companies operating outside the banking sector.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to finance\nministry estimates, PSBs will require Rs 1.8 lakh crore in additional capital\nover a period of four years ending March 2019. Against this, they are expected\nto raise Rs 1.1 lakh crore from the market and through the sale of non-core\nassets.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">SBI has expressed its\nintention to pare its stake in some of the subsidiaries, including its life\ninsurance firm.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">JEW ROTHSCHILDs\nINSURANCE COMPANIES ARE GASSED UP AND READY .&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">MAJJA HAI..&nbsp; KHULLA MAIDAAN \u2026 THANK YOU \u201cMY FRIEND ARUN\u201d</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EXAMPLE-WHY OUR BANKS\nARE UP SHIT CREEK WITHOUT A PADDLE?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b>WISDOM :&nbsp; No capital is required for a well-run bank\nand no amount of capital can save a badly-run bank<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Zoom Developers, an\nIndore-based engineering and logistics company, owes more than Rs 3,000 crore\nto a consortium of 25 banks led by Punjab National Bank. The loans were issued\nto the group between 2005 and 2009. &nbsp;&nbsp;Zoom\nDevelopers has been accused of siphoning off the money and promoter Vijay\nChoudhary is absconding. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Zoom has allegedly\ndiverted funds borrowed from these banks to 350-odd subsidiaries, related\nparties based in India and abroad, and to purchase jewellery for the wife of\nits promoter, Vijay Chaudhary. &nbsp;The banks\ncollectively issued guarantees of Rs 3,000 crore, the collateral with them is\nonly Rs 150 crore. Zoom Developers\u2019 main business was scrapping a plant and\nthen relocating it. In 2004-05, the company decided to use five aggregators,\nmostly from Europe, to get international orders.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Zoom used to sign contracts\nwith these aggregators to execute projects for third parties. The aggregators\nwould make advance payments to Zoom and used to secure this with a bank\nguarantee from an Indian bank of an equal amount issued to the company.Investigators\nhave found that the foreign aggregators were not independent parties. For\ninstance, Chaudhary\u2019s son was a former director of London-based Llondenium\nTrading, one of the aggregators.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">The ED says that others like Astikor AG,\nProject Engineering Management and Hi-Tech Engineer were all controlled by\nChaudhary through a trust called Beverin Stiftung in Liechtenstein. Chaudhary\nis the sole beneficiary of the trust set up in 1997-98. Bebra Engineers did not\noperate from its registered address. There was a Zoom subsidiary operating from\nthe same address.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">In 2006, some lenders\nof Zoom asked it to raise capital. Zoom, in turn, borrowed money from other\nlenders and diverted it to Bebra Engineers which in turn gave this money to\nfive shell companies. These shell companies then individually invested the\nmoney in Zoom Developers. This cycle was repeated for three years till the\ncompany\u2019s capital increased from Rs 40 crore in 2006 to Rs 500 crore in 2008..&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Zoom\ndiverted at least Rs 287 crore out of the Rs 410 crore borrowed from Punjab\nNational Bank for projects in China and Singapore. So far, the ED has\nidentified 30 properties of Zoom Group and multiple foreign bank accounts of\nChaudhary. The ED has issued letter rogatories (LRs) \u2014 a request for assistance\nfrom an Indian court to a foreign court through the External Affairs Ministry \u2013\nto Singapore, US, Italy, Germany and Switzerland asking them to help with the\ninvestigation.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">ED has issued an order\nfor attachment of 1,208 acre land worth Rs 1,000 crore in Soledad in California..\nKabra was on the board of at least 150 companies connected to Zoom Developers\nin India and Singapore, US, Dubai and Philippines. According to Zoom\u2019s bank\nstatements, a lot of money was diverted to these group companies..&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Zoom\nDevelopers (P) Ltd, and its promoter are linked to an offshore trust registered\nin the British Virgin Islands (BVI).. ED said &nbsp;that all foreign entities were controlled by\nChoudhary and most of the projects and contracts, claimed to have been bagged\noffshore by Zoom, were fake. Such entities were floated by Choudhary with the\nhelp of Kabra to cheat banks and to siphon off money.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Various fake\ncontracts/invoices were also prepared by them to cheat Indian and foreign banks..\nIn June 0214, Central Bureau of Investigation claimed that several vital\ndocuments pertaining to the case have been stolen in a conspiracy involving\nsome of its own officials.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">According to the audit,\nZoom Developers diverted at least 35 per cent of the borrowed money to\nsubsidiaries. Another 15 per cent was siphoned off to shell companies such as\nBebra Engineers P Ltd and Zio Technologies Pvt Ltd.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Vijay Chaudhary, the\npromoter of Indore and Mumbai-based Zoom Developers, sought loans from a number\nof Indian banks to develop properties in Europe and the US.The value of the\nproperty attached in the US is believed to have a market value of&nbsp; Rs 1,000 crore</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">REI Agro was a basmati\nexporter and was also the co-sponsor of the IPL team, Delhi Daredevils, in\n2013.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Winsome Diamonds, was\nexporting jewellery to Dubai with &nbsp;false\nstocks and inflated invoices.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/enforcement-directorate-diamond-remittance-scam-ritesh-jain/1/904426.html\">http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/enforcement-directorate-diamond-remittance-scam-ritesh-jain/1/904426.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his Budget speech on\n1 February 2017, the Union Finance Minister stated that we are largely a tax\nnon-compliant society. His statement signals a serious deficit in tax\ncompliance, reflected in the relevant numbers - ..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Out of 37.1 million\nindividuals who filed tax returns in 2015-16, 9.9 million show income below the\nexemption limit of Rs. 250,000 per year, 19.5 million show income between Rs.\n250,000 to Rs. 500,000, 5.2 million show income between Rs. 500,000 to Rs. 1\nmillion, and only 2.4 million people show income above Rs. 1 million.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of the\n7.6 million individual assesses who declare income above Rs. 500,000, 5.6\nmillion are in the salaried class . These figures are absurdly low for a\ncountry of more than 1.25 billion and aren\u2019t commensurate with the general\neconomic activity seen in our society.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">CHECK OUT THE NUMBER OF PRIVATELY OWNED\nLUXURY BUILDING AND PRIVATE OWNED LUXURY CARS<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">INCOME TAX DEPT HAS\nALWAYS HARASSED SMALL FISH\u2014BUT THEY IGNORED THE BIG FISH</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most common ways of\ntax evasion by NON SALARIED BIG FISH are to suppress the receipts or inflate\nthe expenses, resulting in lower taxable income.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Abuse of various provisions of\ntax incentives/exemptions, including those for agricultural income, is also\nanother widely used practice. \u2013</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">&nbsp;ONLY FARMERS WHO PRODUCE FOOD MUST BE EXEMPTED\nFROM TAX.&nbsp; PEOPLE WHO PRODUCE INEDIBLE CASH\nCROPS MUST PAY TAX<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">DOES INDIA REALLY HAVE\nSO MANY FARMERS ?<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">TAX AUDITING DEPTS MUST\nHAVE A RISK ASSESSMENT FORM. THIS MUST BE PRINTED , SIGNED AND FILED-WITH CC TO\nSEVERAL MONITORING AGENCIES</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mere desk-auditing or\nscrutiny assessment by a BABU wont do.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This process of\nscrutiny assessments consumes most of the resources and energy of the\nDepartment, while contributing little to augmentation of collections. The\nprocess has become akin to the tax authorities chasing their own tail<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">THE INCOME TAX DEPT HAS\nFAILED TO HARNESS BIG FISH\u2014DUE TO LACK OF KNOWLEDGE AND DETERMINATION </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Large taxpayers (mostly\ncorporate) using sophisticated and evolved methods of tax avoidance and\nevasion. These are in the form of complex arrangements of transactions through\ncobweb of various entities; shifting of profits to low-rate jurisdictions\nincluding tax heavens; abuse of tax incentive schemes; manipulations in the\nbooks of accounts, etc. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are certain\nindustries such as real estate, film, fashion, mining, construction, gems and\njewellery, which are highly prone to manipulations and have deep-rooted\nlegacies and practices of deviant behaviour. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is important for the\ntax administration to develop specialisation and domain knowledge of various\nsectors of the economy to carry out effective audits .. The auditing of large\ntaxpayers is also required to be conducted jointly by the direct and indirect\ntax authorities in order to achieve effective compliance at reasonable costs\nand manpower.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The internal processes of reporting, review, judicial filings,\nenforcement and departmental communication, which are still carried out on\npaper should be completely shifted to already available e-modes..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The existing\nprocess of auditing, hinged solely on scrutiny assessment, needs to be\ndiversified and organically linked with the processes of risk profiling and\ndata analytics. \u2013 <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">ASK ANY BIG SHOT IN THE\nIT DEPT TO GIVE AN EXTEMPORE SPEECH ON RISK ASSESSMENT\u2014IT WILL BE AN EYE OPENER\n, AS TO HOW IGNORANT THEY ARE</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/dynamic-risk-assessment-on-chemical.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/dynamic-risk-assessment-on-chemical.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Large numbers of hawala&nbsp; operators and accommodation entry providers,\nwho are ready to offer low-cost services for manipulations of transactions, are\nalso part of the ecosystem that has developed a high level of resistance to\nanti-evasion measures.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The tax evasion in these cases is often linked to other\nmethods and areas, which serve as beds of parallel economy. Parallel economy,\nbased on the black money or unaccounted money, is a big menace to the Indian\neconomy.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;It is also a cause of big loss in the tax-revenues for the government..\nThe annual rate of growth of black economy is higher than the annual growth\nrate of GDP.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before demonetization ,\nIndia had among the highest usage of cash across global economies. 98.2 % &nbsp;percent of all transactions by volume happened\nin cash. &nbsp;70 &nbsp;% of the total value of transactions were\nconducted in cash.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More than 40% of the\nIndian economy goes &nbsp;unaccounted. A\nprevalence of cash often allows an \u201cinformal\u201d or \u201cshadow\u201d economy\u2014one that is\nnot taxed, monitored by government, or included in the GDP\u2014to grow or dominate.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RBI data suggested that the proportion of Rs 500 and 1000 notes was 86.4\npercent of total value of notes in circulation on March 31, 2016, amounting to\nRs 14 lakh crore. The growth rates in these notes was 76 percent and 109\npercent respectively in the last 5 years versus the 40 percent increase in\noverall currency..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the\nReserve Bank of India\u2019s annual report published this year, more than 2.61 lakh\ncounterfeit notes in the denomination of Rs 500 were detected by banks in the\nyear 2015-2016 while another 1.43 lakh fake notes of Rs 1000 were detected. By\nvalue, counterfeit notes of Rs 500 and Rs 1000 accounted for more than 92% of\nall the fake currency detected by banks across the country.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>THE HUMONGOUS &nbsp;INCOME TAX DEPT IS A PARASITE WITHIN THE INNARDS\nOF BHARATMATA &nbsp;AND MUST BE ABOLISHED .. &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>DOES ANYBODY KNOW HOW MUCH WE SPEND IN\nSALARIES, PENSIONS AND INFRASTRUCTURE OF IT DEPT &nbsp;?&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE ASK \u201cMY FRIED ARUN\u201d TO BE TRANSPARENT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; text-decoration: none;\">March 17, 2017 at 2:09 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_81MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nAS A SHIP CAPTAIN AS A PART OF PREDICTIVE MAINTENANCE , I ENSURED CALIBRATION --WHEN SUCH THINGS WERE NOT REQUIRED TO BE DONE<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/calibration-on-chemical-tankers-capt.html</span><br />\n<br />\nWE ASK THE MODI GOVT TO ENGAGE IN CALIBRATION<br />\n<br />\nWE DONT NEED TO KNOW OF OUR GDP GROWTH FROM JEW ROTHSCHILDs AGENCIES LIKE FITCH/ MOODYs/ S&amp;P ETC<br />\n<br />\nNow we are jumping into GST--<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br />A successful implementation of the goods and services tax (GST) will require an efficient IT infrastructure and capacity building of the entire tax administration.</span><br />\nThe general sales tax (GST), which subsumes 15 Central and state taxes on goods and services, will create one single indirect tax rate across states, and make India a truly unified market.<br />\n<br />\nThe existing system of Central Value Added Tax (CENVAT) and State VAT suffers from the cascading effect, and thereby leads to high tax on consumers, and different input tax credit from the Centre and states, as the two were not inter-linked, and to differential state VAT rates.<br />\n<br />\nThe proposed integrated or Dual GST, where there will be central GST and state GST, would replace this system.<br />\n<br />\nAs the proposed GST is a destination-based tax, the tax burden will shift from the state of origin to the state of consumption, and result in less revenue for manufacturing and developed states.<br />\n<br />\nThough the GST would compensate states for any revenue loss for the first five years, it is not good news for developed states, which have invested in infrastructure and other utilities to attract investment and industries for growth<br />\n<br />\nCalibration is a comparison to a known physical standard. Our global marketplace dictates accepted standards to facilitate commerce across geographical borders, and recognized standards for comparison are integral to this.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">Ensuring high-speed IT connectivity across states with huge geographical disparity is a short time is imperative . The entire tax administration needs capacity building to handle the GST.</span><br />\n<br />\nThe GST is called the world\u2019s most complex tax reform, where 7.5 million businesses can register, make payments, and file returns on a GST portal. It is really a big relief for business, as even today, because of layers of taxes and exemptions, the cost of tax compliance in India is too high.<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/predictive-maintenance-on-chemical.html</span><br />\n<br />\nWE ASK THE MODI GOVT TO GO TO PREDICTIVE MAINTENANCE<br />\n<br />\nWE ASK THE MODI GOVT TO TRAIN ALL CONCERNED IN \"RISK ASSESSMENT \"--THE FRUIT MUST NOT BE KEPT IN THE MANN MANDIR, BUT PRINTED , SIGNED AND FILED<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/dynamic-risk-assessment-on-chemical.html</span><br />\n<br />\nCalibration is a way of assigning values to the parameters which determine how our models function. Unlike estimation, calibration does not assign parameter values to make the model fit the data.<br />\n<br />\nEstimation will set kind, structure and coefficients. Calibration will tweak coefficients, holding kind and structure constant. You calibrate the model until it works as correctly as you want it, and then you use it for estimating of what will happen in the future.<br />\n<br />\nDUH<br />\n<br />\nDUH<br />\n<br />\nFUCKIN' DUH !<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">The Modi government MUST calibrate its budgetary tax collection estimate post implementation of GST from 1 July 2017.</span><br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Grace and peace !</b></span></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/sxZsOXsePHo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/sxZsOXsePHo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">sri-nrsimha, jaya nrsimha, jaya jaya nrsimha&nbsp;</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">prahladesa jaya padma-mukha-padma-bhrnga</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; All glories to Lord Narasimhadeva, who is the Lord of Prahlada Maharaja and, like the honeybee, is always engaged in beholding the lotuslike face of the goddess of fortune.</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">Narasimha Pranama</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">namas te narasimhaya, prahladahlada-dayine</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">hiranyakasipor vakshah, sila-tanka-nakhalaye</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">\u201cI offer my respectful obeisances unto You, Lord Narasimhadeva. You are the giver of pleasure to Maharaja Prahlada, and Your nails cut the chest of Hiranyakashipu like a chisel cutting stone.\u201d</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">ito nrsimhah parato nrsimho, yato yato yami tato nrsimhah</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">bahir nrsimho hrdaye nrsimho, nrsimham adim saranam prapadye</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">\u201cLord Narasimhadeva is here, and He is also there on the opposite side.
