So they were kicked out of school and went to the street\nto sell newspapers and clean shoes, and they couldn\u2019t study.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">11:32 But North Korean\nkids have a free education system so everybody was happy there because they\ncould go to school. So I thought, \u201cOh my God they are so miserable\u2026I felt so\nbad. So that\u2019s why we thought we were the best country in the world.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Question: Wouldn\u2019t\nYeonmi at least mention that she couldn\u2019t afford to go to school? If that were\nreally true, we would expect her to say something like \u201cI learned the North\nKorean propaganda that we have a free education system and are the best in the\nworld, but since I couldn\u2019t afford to go to school, I discovered the propaganda\nabout the free education system was false.\u201d But she never said anything like\nthat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Q22: DID YEONMI\u2019S\nFAMILY CROSS MOUNTAINS TO GET INTO CHINA?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Request: I see that way\ntoo many people are debating this issue. The crossing three mountains doesn't\nmake sense, but let's focus on Part I. This is just for reference.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Note: In Yeonmi\u2019s\ninitial escape story, she crossed the border with both parents and never\nmentioned climbing any mountains.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the second escape\nstory, Yeonmi started claiming that she had to climb three mountains to reach\nChina. However, she was living in a city on the border (Hyesan), where there\nare no mountains to cross in order to reach China. Journalist Mary Ann Jolley\nquestioned Yeonmi\u2019s claim of climbing three mountains to reach China. This is\nYeonmi\u2019s response, and my follow-up question for Yeonmi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">http://thediplomat.com/2014/12/the-strange-tale-of-yeonmi-park/<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">UPDATE: A Response from\nYeonmi Park (December 2014, Yeonmi\u2019s response to her criticism in the Diplomat\narticle)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And there are mountains\nyou can even see on Google Earth \u2013 maybe you call them big hills in English \u2013\noutside of Hyesan that we crossed to escape.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uDXkdjx7VAE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I Am a North Korean\nMillennial - Yeonmi Park (July 10, 2014)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2:26 In 2004, my whole\nworld came crashing down. My father, my hero was arrested for his illegal\ntrading business\u2026And because of that, I could not live in Pyongyang anymore, so\nI had to go back to Hyesan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p0288zd0<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6:05 (BBC Radio host)\nHe decided it was time for the family to escape from North Korea. (After your\nfather was released from prison)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6:10 (Yeonmi) Yes, we\nall reunited in 2006 and moved back to Hyesan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Question: After\nYeonmi\u2019s father went to prison, her family moved back to Hyesan. The city of\nHyesan continues to be a major defection point because the city is right on the\nborder of China -- with only a river (and no mountains) to cross.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yeonmi\u2019s sister\nabruptly fled across the border to China. The most common/logical route that\nshe would\u2019ve taken into China (as so many other defectors have) is through the\ncity and across the river.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yeonmi\u2019s family wanted\nto find her sister, who just crossed the border into China.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So why would Yeonmi\u2019s\nfamily go outside of Hyesan to cross the border by traveling over three\nmountains and a river?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Q23: WHAT IS YEONMI\u2019S\nEARLIEST MEMORY?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">http://www.independent.ie/irish-news/one-young-world/crouching-tiger-hidden-dragon-one-young-worlds-dramatic-curtainraiser-30674883.html<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(0:23) My earliest\nmemory was when I was really little my mother told me not to even whisper. I\nwas like 4 years old when she said, the birds and mice can hear you, so you\nshould never ever express your feelings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p0288zd0\n(Yeonmi\u2019s interview with BBC Radio: October 16, 2014)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(1:50) I saw public\nexecutions since I was age 1, 2, 3, 4.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Q24: DOES CASEY\nLARTIGUE DESERVE PRAISE FOR NOT MENTIONING YEONMI\u2019S (CONTRIVED) RAPE STORY,\nBECAUSE HE COULD HAVE GAINED FAME AND FORTUNE?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">http://koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2014/12/626_170000.html<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rushing to judgment on\na defector (Casey Lartigue\u2019s response to Yeonmi\u2019s criticism in the Diplomat.com\narticle)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By Casey Lartigue, Jr<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Park's critics have\neven come after me. More than a month before the world learned it, Park told me\nin a recorded interview about her mother being raped in China. Despite the\nopportunity for fame and fortune, I didn't take the opportunities to reveal her\nsensitive information.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Comment: What a bizarre\nand inappropriate comment. Yeonmi told Lartigue about the rape story (which she\nclearly invented anyway) and he deserves our praise because: \u201cDespite the\nopportunity for fame and fortune, I didn't take the opportunities to reveal her\nsensitive information.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is simply\nstunning. Read more about Mr. Lartigue in the conclusion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PART IV: CONCLUSION<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I made this document\nbecause I care about truth, human rights and North Korean defectors. I want\ndefectors to be fully supported and prosper without misleading people. After\nMary Ann Jolley\u2019s original article at the Diplomat.com, it became obvious that\nYeonmi has not been honest, but I noticed that many people are still strongly\nsupporting Yeonmi and criticizing Jolley. A professor in Australia called\nLeonid Petrov even tweeted that Jolley\u2019s article was \u201cdisgusting and mean.\u201d Are\nthese people even reading her article?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I sympathize with North\nKorean defectors and I know Yeonmi is relatively young. But she\u2019s old enough to\nknow the difference between right and wrong. And defectors should not be above\nlegitimate questions and criticisms if it appears they are not being honest.\nJournalists and media organizations were willing to frequently repeat Yeonmi's\nstory without question, even when it clearly contradicted what she told other\njournalists.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So when Mary Ann Jolley\npointed out obvious contradictions in Yeonmi's story, no other journalists were\nwilling to do some investigating and write a follow-up article? Tons of\narticles repeated (and continue to repeat) whatever Yeonmi says, but only one\ncritical article comes out, despite the documented contradictions that Jolley\nbrought to our attention? Doesn't the public deserve to know what's going on?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some people will\nundoubtedly still support Yeonmi despite all the evidence against her. These\npeople should ask themselves why. Yeonmi\u2019s high-profile fabrications are\nseriously harming North Korean defectors because people might not believe them\nafter such a huge international embarrassment. The North Korea propaganda\ndepartment and some North Korea supporters will probably seize upon Yeonmi\u2019s\nlies to repeat their own false claims that all North Korean defectors are\nliars. Many defectors\u2019 stories are surely true, but will people care to listen\nanymore? I hope so.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The other reason I made\nthis document was the suspicious Yeonmi Park Foundation website. Mary Ann\nJolley pointed out that the website had a PayPal donate button, but there was\nno mention of how the money would be used. I was concerned that honest people\nwho want to help defectors might be sending their money into the wrong hands,\nso I started to look more closely at Yeonmi\u2019s story.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What I found was\nabsolutely stunning and outrageous, so I started gathering it on one document,\nwhich is now more than 20 pages long. I was relieved when Yeonmi responded to\nthe Diplomat article by taking her foundation website down. Her explanation\n(\u201cit was a dummy site made by a friend that accidentally went live and couldn\u2019t\nreally receive donations\u201d) is obviously very dubious. Someone should\ndouble-check that claim.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\u2019s also quite a\ncoincidence that Yeonmi and the people around her didn\u2019t notice that this\n\u201cdummy website\u201d had \u201caccidentally gone live\u201d until after Mary Ann Jolley\npublished her critique. We should be thanking Jolley for having the courage to\npublish her article and helping to ensure that donations to defectors go\nthrough reputable charities, with oversight and clear guidelines for how they\nwill use the money.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CASEY LARTIGUE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I should also mention a\nfew things I came across regarding Casey Lartigue Jr. Mr. Lartigue seems to be\nquite a character, and apparently loves the attention he receives when he\u2019s\nwith defectors. For example, Lartigue and a defector named Ju Chan-yang went to\na conference in India. In a South Korean newspaper called the Korea Times,\nLartigue writes about his experience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lartigue was \u201crapping\nto my revised version of Salt N Pepa\u2019s 1990s song \u201cWhattaman,\u201d on the same\nstage that defector Ju Chan-yang told her story, when there \u201cwasn\u2019t a dry eye\nin the audience.\u201d Quite an odd juxtaposition, to say the least.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lartigue also serves up\nanother rap performance on the \u201cCasey Lartigue Show with Yeonmi Park,\u201d a\npodcast focusing on Ms. Park\u2019s experiences (however real) in North Korea,\nwherein Mr. Lartigue adds nothing of substantive value to the discussion. I\nthink Mr. Lartigue wrote the name of the show backwards.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(Honest) North Korean defectors\ndeserve to be center stage, but Lartigue wants all eyes on him. In another\nKorea Times article, Lartigue writes a letter to himself, praising himself for\nhis work with defectors. (You can\u2019t make this stuff up).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the many reasons\nhe heaps praise on himself is that he supposedly rejected a \u201cdream job\u201d that\nwould\u2019ve paid him triple the amount he\u2019s earning now, so he can stay in South\nKorea and work with defectors. He begins the article (written to himself),\n\u201cDearest Casey,\u201d and writes things like:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cWhen you say that you\nare engaged in NK activism because you want to do it, you mean that. It is out\nof joy. You have turned down other great job opportunities. When people ask why\nyou are doing it, why do you spend so much time helping North Korean refugees,\nyou usually answer, \"Because it should be done.\u201d I can\u2019t believe any\neditor could read something like this and actually decide to print it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FINAL COMMENTS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\u2019s infuriating that\nCasey Lartigue and Yeonmi Park have warped the North Korean human rights\nmovement into their own little show, where lies and self-aggrandizement\nprevail. Yeonmi deserves the most criticism, followed by Lartigue, but there\nare others who also deserve blame too. Yeonmi\u2019s mother must know what\u2019s going\non. South Korean newspapers are definitely covering the Yeonmi Park story. I\nalso wonder how Liberty in North Korea (LINK) didn\u2019t speak up or put an end to\nYeonmi\u2019s fabrications. Yeonmi is one of LINK\u2019s leading fundraisers, and they\nactively promote her, but nobody at LINK noticed anything wrong with Yeonmi\u2019s\nstory?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One incorrect\nconclusion that some commenters have made is that Yeonmi must be innocent and\ncoached to lie by people like Lartigue. Remember, Yeonmi started lying at least\nas far back as January 2013, when she claimed she never saw anyone in North\nKorea starving or eating grass. That was long before she started working with\nLartigue. THE DAY SHASTRI WAS MURDERED , NETAJI SUBHASH CHANDRA BOSE WAS IN THE SAME TASHKENT HOTEL .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-size: medium;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-size: medium;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">NETAJI SUBHASH CHANDRA BOSE ATTENDED NEHRUs FUNERAL HOPING TO BE MADE PM BY POPULAR PEOPLEs CALL-- HE WAS SHOVED OFF UNCEREMONIOUSLY BY SHASTRI FROM THE FUNERAL SITE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-size: medium;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-size: medium;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/netaji-subhash-chandra-bose-untold.html<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-size: medium;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-size: medium;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">WE ASK AJIT DOVAL, NIRMALA SITARAMAN AND RAJNATH SINGH-- FOLLOW YOUR OATHS YOU MADE BEFORE YOU SAT ON YOUR CHAIR OF POWER. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_14.html?showComment=1526437008705#c2067040711618924718\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 16, 2018 at 7:46 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_162MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nTHE WHITE JEW DOES NOT WANT ANY NON-WHITE RACE TO HAVE A NUCLEAR BOMB...<br />\n<br />\nNORTH KOREA , INDIA, PAKISTAN FALL IN THE CATEGORY..<br />\n<br />\nSADDAM HUSSAIN HAD A NUCLEAR PLANET, BECAUSE MY SHIP WHERE I WAS A UNMARRIED CHIEF OFFICER CARRIED IT FROM ITALY TO KUWAIT ..<br />\n<br />\nAT LOADING END IN ITALY IT CAME BY HUGE TRUCKS ( AT A ROAD RIDE OUTSIDE HARBOUR ) AND SAME WAY IT WAS UNLOADED DIRECT ON TO HUGE TRUCKS AT A-KUWAIT..EARLY 1981.<br />\n<br />\nSINCE IRAN WAS AT WAR WITH IRAQ, WHATEVER WE LOADED ON DECK WAS SHIELDED-- ALL MARKINGS WERE OBLITERATED USING BLACK PAINT.<br />\n<br />\nOUR SHIP HAD EXTRA LONG HOLDGS AND JUMBO DERRICKS OF 125 TONS.<br />\n<br />\nWHITE NUCLEAR INSPECTORS PAINTED THE TARGET INITIALLY FOR THE WHITE JEW MISSILES TO TAKE THEM OUT WITH GPS PRECISION..<br />\n<br />\nSAME WILL HAPPEN TO NORTH KOREA.. NUCLEAR INSPECTORS SEND BY WHITE JEWS WILL PAINT NORTH KOREAN TARGETS -SO THAT THEY CAN TAKE IT OUT WITH GPS PRECISION<br />\n<br />\nAS SOON A KIM LOSES HIS NUCLEAR INSURANCE POLICY--HE IS AT THE MERCY OF TRUMP WHO APPEARS NOW TO BE TOTALLY CONTROLLED BY THE DEEP STATE FORCES AND MOSSAD..<br />\n<br />\nWHY IS ISRAEL HAVING NUCLEAR BOMB? BECAUSE THE US DEEP STATE GAVE THEM THE WHEREWITHAL.<br />\n<br />\nUS PRESIDENT JFK WAS ASSASSINATED BY THE US DEEP STATE -- BECAUSE HE CRACKED DOWN ON THE ISRAELI LOBBY WITHIN THE DEEP STATE.. HE WANTED ISRAELI DIMONA NUCLEAR FACILITY TO BE INSPECTED..<br />\n<br />\nConstruction of the SECRET Israeli nuclear facility began in 1958 and its heavy-water nuclear reactor went active sometime in 1963.<br />\n<br />\nIsrael maintains a policy known as nuclear ambiguity\u2014refusing either to confirm or deny their possession of nuclear missiles.<br />\n<br />\nIsrael had produced its first nuclear weapons by 1967 and it has been estimated to possess more than 420 nuclear weapons<br />\n<br />\nConstruction commenced in 1958, with French Rothschild assistance-- Protocol of S\u00e8vres agreements<br />\n<br />\nThe complex was constructed in secret, and outside the International Atomic Energy Agency inspection regime<br />\n<br />\nTo maintain secrecy, French customs officials were told that the largest of the reactor components, such as the reactor tank, were part of a desalination plant bound for Latin America<br />\n<br />\nWhen the United States intelligence community discovered the purpose of the site in the early 1960s, the U.S. government demanded that Israel agree to international inspections.<br />\n<br />\nIsrael agreed, but on the condition that U.S ( READ AS DEEP STATE ) ., rather than International Atomic Energy Agency, inspectors be used, and that Israel would receive advance notice of all inspections..<br />\n<br />\nThe inspectors eventually informed the U.S. government that their inspections were useless, due to Israeli restrictions on what areas of the facility they could inspect.<br />\n<br />\nIn 1986, Mordechai Vanunu, a former technician at Dimona, fled to the United Kingdom and revealed to the media some evidence of Israel's nuclear program and explained the purposes of each building, also revealing a top-secret underground facility directly below the installation.<br />\n<br />\nThe Mossad, Israel's secret service, sent a female agent named Cheryl Bentov (Hanin) who lured Vanunu to Italy, where he was kidnapped by Mossad agents and smuggled to Israel aboard a freighter.<br />\n<br />\nAn Israeli court then tried him in secret on charges of treason and espionage, and sentenced him to eighteen years imprisonment<br />\n<br />\nThe Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi claimed during a United Nations General Assembly speech in 2009 that Israel had ordered the killing of President John F. Kennedy because Kennedy had wanted to investigate the Negev Nuclear Plant.</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_162B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/10/ethnic-cleansing-of-blackskinned-people.html</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_162B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_162MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nBut how can we expect Iran to curb its nuclear ambitions if the Israelis won't come clean?<br />\n<br />\nIRAN HAS THE WHEREWITHAL TO CONVERT USA TO STONE AGE AND KILL 90% OF US CITIZENS WITH JUST EMP MISSILES.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_163B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2258016616088898285\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_163M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_14.html?showComment=1526437195190#c2258016616088898285\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 16, 2018 at 7:49 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_163MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nIn 2009, when a veteran Washington reporter, Helen Thomas, asked JEW Barack Obama in the first month of his presidency if he knew of any country in the Middle East with nuclear weapons, he dodged the trapdoor by saying only that he did not wish to \"speculate\"<br />\n<br />\nModi must know this -- since he loves to hug JEW Presidents of France.<br />\n<br />\nFrance took the toughest line on counter-proliferation when it came to Iran helped lay the foundations of Israel's nuclear weapons programme<br />\n<br />\nIn Dimona, French engineers poured in to help build Israel a nuclear reactor and a far more secret reprocessing plant capable of separating plutonium from spent reactor fuel<br />\n<br />\nBy the end of the 50s, there were 2,500 French citizens living in Dimona, transforming it from a village to a cosmopolitan town, complete with French lyc\u00e9es and streets full of Renaults, and yet the whole endeavour was conducted under a thick veil of secrecy.<br />\n<br />\nThe American investigative journalist Seymour Hersh wrote in his book The Samson Option: \"French workers at Dimona were forbidden to write directly to relatives and friends in France and elsewhere, but sent mail to a phony post-office box in Latin America<br />\n<br />\nIsrael refused to countenance visits by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), so in the early 1960s President Kennedy demanded they accept American inspectors.<br />\n<br />\nThe lead American inspector, Floyd Culler, an expert on plutonium extraction, noted in his reports that there were newly plastered and painted walls in one of the buildings.<br />\n<br />\nIt turned out that before each American visit, the Israelis had built false walls around the row of lifts that descended six levels to the subterranean reprocessing plant<br />\n<br />\nIF THE WHITE SKINNED ISRAELIS ( OF KHAZARI GEORGIA ORIGINS ) CAN CLAIM PALESTINE-- THEN BLACK NIGERAIANS CAN CLAIM SAIDI OIL FIELDS AND MECCA AS THEY ARE ALSO MUSLIMS.. IT DOES NOT MATTER OF THEY DONT LOOK LIKE THEIR NEIGHBORS AROUND THEM.<br />\n<br />\nWHY DID GEORGIA HAVE JEWS?<br />\n<br />\nBECAUSE THE KING OF CALICUT OWNED DHOFAR KINGDDOM\u2014SOUTH PART OF OMAN , NORTH PART OF YEMEN.. ONE OF HIS DHOFAR PORTS WAS GWADAR WHERE THERE WAS A DEVI FIRE TEMPLE WITH ETERNAL FLAME.<br />\nCALICUT KINGS SHIPS UNLOADED SPICES AT GWADAR ( PAKISTAN ) AND SALALAH ( OMAN ) AND FROM THEY IT WENT BY OVERLAND ROUTE TO HAIFA ( ISRAEL ) AND BATUMI ( GEORGIA ).. FROM HERE SPICES WERE LOADED ON SHIPS AND TAKEN TO EUROPE..<br />\n<br />\nJEWS WERE MIDDLEMEN FOR SPICES AT GEORGIA AND PALESTINE .<br />\n<br />\nTHE JEWS AT GEORGIA AND PALESTINE WERE CIRCUMCISED AS THEY WERE MOSTLY HOMOSEXUALS\u2014WHO DID NOT WANT SHIT UNDER THE FORESKIN OF THEIR PRICKS..<br />\n<br />\nTHE GEORGIAN JEWS ( KHAZARIA ) WERE SO MEAN WITH CORRUPTED DNA.. THEY SPREAD ALL OVER EUROPE..<br />\n<br />\nJEW HITLER WAS ASKED BY HIS MASTER ROTHSCHILD NT TO ALLOW ANY ANAL SEX RECEIVING GAY IN THE PROMISED LAND. , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">KIM JONG UN , THE RULER OF NORTH KOREA MUST KNOW THIS..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">SOUTH KOREA AND THE WHITE JEWS HAVE BEEN APPLYING THE \"CARROT AND STICK\" POLICY ON NORTH KOREA--LITERALLY TREATING NORTH KOREA LIKE A STUPID DONKEY\u2026</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THIS POLICY IS KNOWN AND THE \"SUNSHINE POLICY\"..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">WELL, AESOP FABLES IS 100% LIFTED FROM \"PANCHATANTRA TALES \" OF INDIA..</span></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/super-panchatantra-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</span></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">APOLLONIUS OF TYANA WAS A SAGE FROM KERALA , WHOSE LEGACY WAS PASSED ON TO A COOKED UP JESUS CHRIST IN 325 AD, AT THE FIRST COUNCIL OF NICEA BY ROMAN EMPEROR CONSTANTIN THE GREAT..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">MOST OF THE PANCHATANTRA TALES WERE NARRATED BY APOLLONIUS OF TYANA .. IN OVER 8 DECADES OF LECTURES IN ROME, AND THESE STORIES WERE KNOWN TO INDIANS THREE MILLINIUMS BEFORE ......</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/10/the-huge-statue-of-colossus-of-rome-at.html</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/12/the-rotating-statue-on-nemi-ship-on.html</span></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">PLATO STOLE THESE STORIES ( TAUGHT AT KODUNGALLUR UNIVERISTY ) PHILOSOPHY CLASSES AND WENT BACK TO GREECE AND NARRATED THEM AS IF HE INVENTED THESE STORIES.. HE NEATLY REPLACED ANIMALS AND BIRDS ( TIGER/ PEACOCK ETC ) WITH WESTERN ANIMALS AND BIRDS ..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">GETTING BACK..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE NORTH WIND AND THE SUN IS A PANCHATANTRA STORY, WRITTEN 5000 YEARS AGO...THIS IS THE BASIS OF THE \"SUNSHINE POLICY\"..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">QUOTE: The North Wind and the Sun were disputing which was the stronger, when a traveler came along wrapped in a warm cloak. They agreed that the one who first succeeded in making the traveler take his cloak off should be considered stronger than the other. Then the North Wind blew as hard as he could, but the more he blew the more closely did the traveler fold his cloak around him; and at last the North Wind gave up the attempt. Then the Sun shined out warmly, and immediately the traveler took off his cloak. And so the North Wind was obliged to confess that the Sun was the stronger of the two.:UNQUOTE&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Sunshine Policy is the policy of South Korea towards North Korea during Kim Dae-jung\u2019s presidency. ..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The formal name of the policy was the \"Comprehensive Engagement Policy towards North Korea\" and first announced by the 15th South Korean President, Kim Dae-jung, in 1998 with white JEW help. He would be given Nobel Prize for this in 2000 AD\u2026</span><br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">By the way KIMs have Indian DNA and are ruler class of Korea.</span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/korean-brahmins-kim-hae-clan-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">NORTH KOREA IS RICHER THAN SAUDI ARABIA..</span></div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/regime-change-in-north-korea-rare.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The term \"Sunshine Policy\" was originated from one of Aesop's fables, \"The North Wind and the Sun,\" as the policy aimed for loosening containment on North Korea, embracing North Korea, and eventually making the North Korean government to denuclearize by itself.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Sunshine Policy refers to the theoretical basis for South Korea's foreign policy towards North Korea\u2026. the idea built on the traditional Korean ways of dealing with enemies by giving them gifts to prevent them from causing harm.. Facing bankruptcy and spending excessive portion of its funds on warfare along with the nuclear program, North Korea faced widespread starvation among its people during the time..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">These principles were meant to convey the message that the South does not wish to absorb the North or to undermine its government; its goal was peaceful co-existence rather than regime change</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Sunshine policy was based on three following principles: ----</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">## No armed provocation by the North will be tolerated.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">## The South will not attempt to absorb the North in any way. ( THE WHITE JEW WANTS THE RARE EARTHS OF NORTH KOREA )</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">## The South actively seeks cooperation.</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">CONTINUED TO 2---</span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_96BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; THEY WANTED NORTH TO COME DOWN ON ITS KNEES AND THEN BE ABSORBED BY SOUTH KOREA. ..<br />\n<br />\nBy addressing the second principle, the South Korea halted forming tension with North Korea and appeased North Korea to reduce its spending in defense..<br />\n<br />\nBesides its direct influence on inter-Korean relations, the Sunshine Policy tremendously helped South Korean economy. It had been historically shown that more than billions of dollar evaporate in just one day whenever North Korea announced some antagonistic policy toward the South or caused military provocation on the South, because foreign investors then regarded the South Korean market as unstable<br />\n<br />\nThe third bullet point explicitly implied that the South would put unprecedented amount of effort and investment into the North if North Korea becomes cooperative. As a result, Kaesong Industrial Region (or KIR), a special administrative industrial region of North Korea, where 53,000 North Koreans and 800 South Koreans are employed and work together, was constructed. .<br />\n<br />\nThere was a substantial economic benefit to South Korea too. At the beginning of Kim Dea-jung's administration, South Korea was just bailed out from the IMF, so the South had to avoid confrontationist policy toward the North. In this sense, this coexistence, reconciliation policy helped South Korea from recovering its economic from the nadir.<br />\n<br />\nThe US DEEP STATE used the Sunshine Policy as a political gain in domestic politics in the South.<br />\n<br />\nBecause of the post-1998 'Sunshine policy', many South Korean nongovernmental organizations and the public weren't concerned about North Korea's threats, believing that Pyongyang would never use nuclear weapons against them..<br />\n<br />\nWITH KIM OF NORTH KOAREA HAVING ICBM MISSILES WHICH CAN DESTROY US CITIES \u201cSUNSHINE POLICCY\u201d IS FLUSED DOWN THE DRAIN..<br />\n<br />\nNORTH KOREANS HAVE SUFFERED ENOUGH.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/japanese-in-hiroshima-and-nagasaki.html</span><br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nPUT ABOVE COMMENT IN WEBSITES OF--<br />\nPMO<br />\nPM MODI<br />\nAJIT DOVAL<br />\nCMs OF ALL STATES ( LEAVE OUT MOOTO AND KACHRAWAAL )<br />\nRSS<br />\nVHP<br />\nAVBP<br />\nSWAMY<br />\nGURUMURTHY<br />\nCJI<br />\nSPEAKER LOK SABHA<br />\nSPEAKER RAJYA SABHA<br />\nNITI AYOG<br />\nAMITABH KANT<br />\n<br />\nALL DESH BHAKT LEADERS OF INDIA<br />\nSPREAD ON SOCIAL MEDIA</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_96b+seedDnIFD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_96b+seedDnIFD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</span></li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_30B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">North Korea's human rights record has been considered the worst in the world and has been globally condemned, with KOSHER DEEP STATE groups such as the United Nations, Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch, and the European Union all critical of the country's record. ..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The General Assembly of the United Nations has since 2003 annually adopted a resolution condemning the country's human rights record. The latest resolution of December 19, 2011, passed by a vote of 123\u201316 with 51 abstentions, urged the government in Pyongyang to end its \"systematic, widespread and grave violations of human rights\", which included public executions and arbitrary detentions.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">North Korea rejected the resolution, saying it was politically motivated and based upon untrue fabrications-- and Capt Ajit Vadakayil agrees with North Korea.</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">PEOPLE WHO KNOW ME WILL VOUCH --THAT CAPT AJIT VADAKAYILs OPINION HAS MORE WEIGHT THAN THE ENTIRE MAIN STREAM MEDIA OF THIS PLANET... font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Yoga allows only DEEP DIAPHRAGMATIC BREATHING\nwhich simulates the Vagus nerve</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/hyperventilation-followed-by-valsalva.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/hyperventilation-followed-by-valsalva.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/eKLqFnAmK6c/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/eKLqFnAmK6c?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Irritable bowel\nsyndrome (IBS) is a common disorder that affects the large intestine (colon)..\nIBS is a chronic condition that you will need to manage long term.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most common\nsymptoms of IBS are :--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Abdominal pain<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cramping<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bloating<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excessive gas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diarrhea<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Constipation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indigestion<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anxiety or depression<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Loss of appetite<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Constipation\nalternating with diarrhea<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A belly that sticks out</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mucus in stools</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Very small bowel\nmovements</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rectal discomfort</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fluid Retention</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Weight loss</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Constant craving,\nmainly carbohydrates</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Headaches or backaches</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tightness around the\nwaist</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Constant urge to go for\na shit.</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/A96IdubMKGo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/A96IdubMKGo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">THE JEWS HAVE MONOPOLISED IBS AND IBD&nbsp; .. ALMOST ALL JEWS HAVE IBS OR IBD<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IBS IS NOT IBD<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Irritable Bowel Syndrome and Inflammatory\nBowel Disease sound the same and are both common illnesses that affect the gut\nbut they are both very different.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The fundamental difference between IBS and\nIBD is that IBD is structural, meaning there is damage to the gut whereas IBS\ncauses gut symptoms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IBD( Inflammatory Bowel Disease ) &nbsp;is characterised by the presence of\ninflammation in the intestine whereas IBS is caused by the dysfunction of the\ndigestive track. IBS does not turn into IBD, but it is possible to have both\nconditions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IBS is best described as a functional bowel\ndisorder that occurs when the bowel acts in an abnormal way without signs of\ndamage caused by disease, and all other tests are negative.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IBD is characterized by an immune-mediated\ninflammatory process that results in ulceration and actual inflammation in the\nintestine<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) includes\nCrohn\u2019s disease and Ulcerative Colitis<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In IBD, inflammation may occur beyond the gut\nto areas such as skin, joints and eyes but this does not occur in IBS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IBS is&nbsp;\nnot life-threatening, and it doesn't make you more likely to get other\ncolon conditions, such as ulcerative colitis, Crohn's disease, or colon cancer.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But IBS can be a long-lasting problem that\nchanges how you live your life. People with IBS may miss work or school more\noften, and they may feel less able to take part in daily activities<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Again, while both irritable bowel syndrome\nand inflammatory bowel disease can have similar symptoms including abdominal\npain, diarrhea, and urgent bowel movements; however, IBS is not the same as IBD,\nwhich is a SEVERE condition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Irritable bowel syndrome is considered a\nfunctional gastrointestinal disorder because there is abnormal bowel function.\nIBS is a group of symptoms and not a disease in itself, which is why it\u2019s\ncalled a \u2018syndrome,\u2019 and it is less serious than IBD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Irritable bowel syndrome does not cause\ninflammation like inflammatory bowel disease, and it does not result in\npermanent damage to the intestines, intestinal bleeding, rectal bleeding,\nulcers, or the harmful complications that are often seen with IBD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">IMPORTANT :--&nbsp;&nbsp; IBS is diagnosed by exclusion, which means a\ndoctor considers other alternatives first, performing tests to rule out other\nmedical problems.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Irritable bowel\nsyndrome is a \"functional\" disorder. This term refers to the changes\nin the functioning of the digestive system that results in the collection of\nsymptoms referred to as IBS, meaning that it is a problem with the movement\n(motility) rather than any damage to the tissues of the digestive system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Poorly coordinated\nsignals between the brain and the intestines can make your body overreact to\nthe changes that normally occur in the digestive process. This overreaction can\ncause pain, diarrhea or constipation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stimuli that don't\nbother other people can trigger symptoms in people with IBS \u2014 but not all\npeople with the condition react to the same stimuli.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The walls of the\nintestines are lined with layers of muscle that contract and relax in a\ncoordinated rhythm as they move food from your stomach through your intestinal\ntract to your rectum.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you have irritable bowel syndrome, the contractions\nmay be stronger and last longer than normal, causing gas, bloating and\ndiarrhea.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Or the opposite may occur, with weak intestinal contractions slowing\nfood passage and leading to hard, dry stools.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The west\nhas increasing cased of IBS and poor immunity &nbsp;due to three reasons:-</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">AAA-\nWomen going for C section delivery rather than natural delivery of babies</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">BBB-\nWomen do NOT breast feed babies for 6 months</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">CCC-\nExcessive consumption of GM foods, Processed foods and A1 toxic milk<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/10/epidurals-when-chutney-mary-fails-her.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/10/epidurals-when-chutney-mary-fails-her.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Read both parts of the\npost below-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;
