, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a corporation is a\nsham, engages in FRAUD or other wrongful acts, or is used solely for the\npersonal benefit of its directors, officers, or shareholders, courts may\ndisregard the separate corporate existence and impose personal liability on the\ndirectors, officers, or shareholders. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In other words, courts\nmay pierce the \"veil\" that the law uses to divide the corporation\n(and its liabilities and assets) from the people behind the corporation. The\nveil creates a separate, legally recognized corporate entity and shields the people\nbehind the corporation from personal liability.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many entrepreneurs\ncreate business entities to operate their businesses, to facilitate commercial\nventures, and to shield themselves from personal liability.&nbsp; The business maintains a separate and\ndistinct identity from that of its owners or related entities.&nbsp; However, the mere shell of a corporate\nstructure is not always enough to avoid personal liability.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Piercing the corporate\nveil is the legal jargon used to describe an action pursued against a company\nthat ultimately leads to personal liability of the owners, shareholders, or\nmembers wherein the corporate structure is disregarded.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This personal liability\nopens owners, shareholders, or members bank accounts, real and personal\nproperty interests, and investments to risk.&nbsp;\nThink of it this way \u2013 the corporate structure is the \u201cveil\u201d that\nprovides protection and if that veil is pierced, there is no more protection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A party wishing to\npierce the corporate veil must show that the corporation at issue is the mere\ninstrumentality or alter ego of its shareholder(s) or its parent corporation,\nand that said shareholder or parent corporation engaged in improper conduct.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of all of the factors\nthat courts look at, the existence of fraud, wrongdoing, or injustice is the\nbiggest red flag when determining whether or not to pierce the corporate\nveil.&nbsp; In a majority of cases, the\nclaimant is seeking to pierce the corporate veil because of the wrongdoing of\nthe company or its owners.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consider the\nfollowing:&nbsp; (1) Creditor of ABC Corp.\nreceives a final judgment for money damages; (2) ABC Corp. cannot pay the\njudgment so it shuts down; (3) ABC Corp. transfers all of its assets to XYZ\nCorp. and XYZ Corp. operates a substantially similar business with the same\nassets and same employees. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this example, it is\nlikely that ABC Corp. engaged in wrongful, potentially fraudulent actions, by\nshutting down its business and essentially reopening a new corporation of the\nsame ilk.&nbsp; This is a classic example of a\ndebtor attempting to defraud its creditor.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The corporate veil is\nused for the purpose of tax evasion or in order to avoid any kind of tax\nobligation. It is not possible for the legislature to fill all the gaps in the\nlaw and thus it is important for the judiciary to interfere.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In such cases, the\ncourts lift the veil of the company to find out the real state of affairs of\nthe company. The leading case of Vodafone was an example of the corporate\nstructure formed to evade the taxes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Indian apex court\nin this case observed that \u2013 \u201cOnce the transaction is shown to be fraudulent,\nsham, circuitous or a device designed to defeat the interests of the\nshareholders, investors, parties to the contract and also for tax evasion, the\nCourt can always lift the corporate veil and examine the substance of the\ntransaction.\u201d The Court, in this case, entitled the Income Tax Office to pierce\nthe corporate veil of the company.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Where a company is\nacting as an agent for its shareholders, in such cases the principle of\nvicarious liability is applied, and the shareholders will be responsible for\nthe acts of the company. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The court in such cases\nwould look at the facts of the cases to determine whether the company is acting\nan agent for its members or not. This can be inferred either from the agreement\nwhere it has been expressly mentioned or can be implied from the circumstances\nof each case.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS POST IS NOW CONTINUED TO PART 15, BELOW-</span></b><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_9.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/shell-companies-for-money-laundering_9.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WUnI7jf3Z_Q/WL-LBgdKUGI/AAAAAAABRjI/jx2iIyJP1AMm7LV8GS_2moYry_bbZU60gCLcB/s1600/20161222_120707_resized.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WUnI7jf3Z_Q/WL-LBgdKUGI/AAAAAAABRjI/jx2iIyJP1AMm7LV8GS_2moYry_bbZU60gCLcB/s640/20161222_120707_resized.jpg\" width=\"386\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Inc., was created in 2007 just to take the fall in\nan earlier kickback case against a Pfizer-owned company. It was used again in\nthe&nbsp; Bextra case.. Pfizer, the world's\nlargest pharmaceutical company, was caught illegally marketing Bextra, a\npainkiller that was taken off the market in 2005 because of safety concerns. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://edition.cnn.com/2010/HEALTH/04/02/pfizer.bextra/\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://edition.cnn.com/2010/HEALTH/04/02/pfizer.bextra/</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So now, instead of\nPfizer itself, Pharmacia &amp; Upjohn Co. Inc. can\u2019t sell meds to Medicare and\nMedicaid\u2013but since this shell corporation has never sold a single pill to begin\nwith.&nbsp; Pfizer was charged with a crime --\nbut the company's \"imaginary SHELL friend\" took all the blame.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, so --you won't hear\nPfizer being charged with any crime, because it was actually Pharmacia &amp;\nUpjohn Co. Inc, a Pfizer <span style=\"background-color: white;\">SHELL</span> subsidiary, that took the rap.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reputation of EVIL\nPHARMA remains intact..&nbsp;&nbsp; The subsidiary\nis nothing more than a shell company whose only function is to plead guilty. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHY DO PEOPLE LIKE\nPRINCE CHARLES COME TO INDIA FOR A PILGRIMAGE AS IF PUNE SERUM INSTITUTE IS THE\nTAJ MAHAL?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DOCTORS ARE BRIBED TO\nDELIBERATELY MIS SPELL THE SPELLINGS OF THE MEDICINES THEIR PRESCRIBE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.alternet.org/drugs/big-pharma-simple-trick-obscuring-medical-bribes\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.alternet.org/drugs/big-pharma-simple-trick-obscuring-medical-bribes</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SO EAJJJJY !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MAJJA HAI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">KISSI KOH KUCH NAHIN\nPATHA !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">JUST CORRUPT THE\nHANDWRITING TO A CHICKEN SCRATCH WHILE WRITING PRESCRIPTIONS</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/09/why-doctors-write-illegible.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/09/why-doctors-write-illegible.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Money laundering and\norganized crime have become crucial concerns for financial institutions and\ngovernments around the world. Specialized governmental agencies labeled\n\u201cfinancial intelligence units\u201d or \u201cFIUs\u201d were established in countries around\nthe world to aid in the prevention of money laundering and organized crime. They\noffer law enforcement agencies around the world an important avenue for information\nexchange<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Financial intelligence\n(FININT) is the gathering of information about the financial affairs of\nentities of interest, to understand their nature and capabilities, and predict\ntheir intentions. Generally the term applies in the context of law enforcement\nand related activities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the main\npurposes of financial intelligence is to identify financial transactions that\nmay involve tax evasion, money laundering or some other criminal activity.\nFININT may also be involved in identifying financing of criminal and terrorist\norganisations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Financial intelligence\ncan be broken down into two main areas, collection and analysis. Collection is\nnormally done by a government agency, know as a financial intelligence\norganisation or Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The agency will collect raw\ntransactional information and Suspicious activity reports (SAR) usually\nprovided by banks and other entities as part of regulatory requirements. Data\nmay be shared with other countries through intergovernmental networks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Analysis, may consist\nof scrutinizing a large volume of transactional data using data mining or\ndata-matching techniques to identify persons potentially engaged in a particular\nactivity. SARs can also be scrutinized and linked with other data to try and\nidentify specific activity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FININT involves\nscrutinizing a large volume of transactional data, usually provided by banks\nand other entities as part of regulatory requirements. Alternatively, data\nmining or data-matching techniques may be employed to identify persons\npotentially engaged in a particular activity.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FIU-IND is the central\nnational agency of India responsible for receiving, processing, analyzing and\ndisseminating information relating to suspect financial transactions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FIU-IND\nis also responsible for coordinating and strengthening efforts of national and\ninternational intelligence, investigation and enforcement agencies in pursuing\nthe the global efforts against money laundering,related crimes and terrorist\nfinancing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FIU-IND is not a\nregulatory authority. Its prime responsibility is to gather and share financial\nintelligence in close cooperation with the regulatory authorities including\nRBI, SEBI and IRDA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many industrialized\ncountries have regulatory reporting requirements for its financial\norganisations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Examples of financial\nintelligence analysis could include:---</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Identifying high-risk\nhousing tenants on the basis of past rental histories.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deterring tax payers\ntrying to avoid their fiduciary obligations by moving wealth surreptitiously\nout of a tax-levying jurisdiction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Discovering safe havens\nwhere criminals park the proceeds of crime.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Accounting for how a\nlarge sum of money handed to a targeted individual disappears<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Checking to see if a\ncorrupt individual has had any sudden and unexplained windfalls.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Detecting relationships\nbetween terrorist cells through remittances.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shell companies are\nalso involved in billing schemes, a form of occupational fraud. Occupational\nfraud is divided into three categories: corruption, fraudulent statements, and\nasset misappropriations. Billing schemes fall beneath the asset misappropriation\ncategory of occupational fraud. There are two forms of billing schemes: shell\ncompany schemes and pass-through schemes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In a shell company scheme, an employee,\nusually involved with purchasing, will create a false vendor to submit fake\ninvoices for payment to their employer. The employer will pay the invoice\nassuming it was for legitimate services. The payment is then deposited into a\nfalsified business bank account allowing the money to be accessible to the\ncriminal or criminals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In a pass-through scheme, an employee will\ncreate what seems to be a legitimate business and use it to purchase goods or\nservices from their employer. Thereafter, they mark the goods up and then sell\nback to their employer, pocketing the profit from the mark-up.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Red flag indicators for\nbilling schemes include:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Invoices for\nunspecified services or \u201csoft\u201d billings such as consulting or advertising<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Unfamiliar vendors<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Vendors with P.O.\nBoxes only<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Vendors with company\nnames consisting of initials only<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Rapidly increasing\npurchases from one vendor<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Vendor billings more\nthan once a month<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Vendor addresses that\nmatch employee addresses<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Large billings broken\ninto multiple smaller invoices<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Internal control\ndeficiencies<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Unfolded invoices\nwhich may indicate they weren\u2019t mailed<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fictitious service\nschemes are another type of scam that shell companies are connected with. A\ncriminal will create a false company and then enter into a contract with\nanother business offering an intangible service, such as consulting.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\npayments are received from the legitimate business for alleged consulting\nservices, the criminals deposit the money into their own accounts.\nUnfortunately, fictitious service schemes are tough to take legal action\nagainst. Since a number of state agencies don\u2019t collect enough information\npertaining to company formations, it\u2019s difficult for authorities to identify\nthe criminal(s) for prosecution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The asset\nmisappropriation schemes like skimming, larceny, register schemes, and cheque\ntampering\u2014all require the scheme\u2019s perpetrator to physically take cash or\ncheques from his employer<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Asset misappropriation\nscheme, is one which allows the perpetrator to misappropriate company funds\nwithout ever actually handling cash or cheques while at work. These schemes\nsucceed by making a false claim for payment upon the victim organisation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\ngroup consists of billing schemes (which attack the company\u2019s purchasing function),\npayroll schemes, and expense reimbursement schemes. The most common of these is\nthe billing scheme.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Billing schemes are a\npopular form of employee fraud mainly because they offer the prospect of large\nrewards. Since most businesses\u2019 disbursements are made in the purchasing cycle,\nlarger thefts can be hidden through false-billing schemes than through other\nkinds of fraudulent disbursements.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are three principal types of billing\nschemes: false invoicing via shell companies, false invoicing via nonaccomplice\nvendors, and personal purchases made with company funds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cheques received will\nbe made out in the shell company\u2019s name, the perpetrator will normally also set\nup a bank account in his new company\u2019s name so he can deposit and cash the\nfraudulent cheques.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A person will probably\nhave to present a bank with a certificate of incorporation or an assumed-name\ncertificate in order to open a bank account for a shell company. These are\ndocuments that a company must obtain through the government.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The documents can\nbe forged, but it is more likely that the perpetrator will simply file the\nrequisite paperwork and obtain legitimate documents from the relevant\njurisdiction. This can usually be accomplished for a small fee, the cost of\nwhich will be more than offset by a successful fraud scheme.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If it is discovered\nthat a vendor is falsely billing a company, investigators for the victim\ncompany might be able to identify the suspect company\u2019s owner by reviewing its\nbusiness registration filings, which are a matter of public record in many\ncountries.<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KwtMdATxH10/WL6BYLqFdMI/AAAAAAABRg8/EGfGfGclzXsdlg7rTTW3ob6DgLoHdYY4ACLcB/s1600/schsseme.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KwtMdATxH10/WL6BYLqFdMI/AAAAAAABRg8/EGfGfGclzXsdlg7rTTW3ob6DgLoHdYY4ACLcB/s640/schsseme.png\" width=\"586\" /></a></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To avoid being detected\nthrough a records search, some perpetrators form their shell companies under\nanother name. It is common, for instance, for employees to set up shell\ncompanies in the name of a spouse or other close relative. Male fraudsters\noften establish shell companies under their wives\u2019 maiden names. An employee\nmight also form the company under a completely fictitious name.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EXAMPLE:&nbsp; An employee used a colleague\u2019s identification\nto form a shell vendor. The fraudster then proceeded to bill his employer for\napproximately $20,000 in false services. He deposited the resulting cheques in\nthe shell company\u2019s account and withdrew currency through an ATM.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another issue involved\nin forming a shell company is the entity\u2019s address\u2014the place where fraudulent\ncheques will be collected. Often, an employee rents a PO Box and lists it as\nhis shell company\u2019s mailing address. Some employees list their home address\ninstead. A comparison of employee addresses to vendor addresses might reveal\nshell companies in an accounts payable system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EXAMPLE:&nbsp; A department head set up a dummy company\nusing his residence as the mailing address. Over a two-year period, this man\nsubmitted over $250,000 worth of false invoices. Eventually, a newly hired\nclerk detected the scheme. The clerk was processing an invoice when she noticed\nthat the vendor\u2019s address was the same as her boss\u2019s address. (By a lucky\ncoincidence, the clerk had typed a personal letter for her boss earlier that\nday and remembered his address.) Had the department head used a PO Box instead\nof his home address on the invoices, his scheme might have continued\nindefinitely.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Employees often use\ntheir home addresses to collect fraudulent disbursements because many\nbusinesses are wary of sending cheques to vendors that have a PO Box for a\nmailing address. Other common collection sites for shell company schemes are\nthe addresses of relatives, friends, or accomplices.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Submitting False\nInvoices--&nbsp;&nbsp; Once a shell company has\nbeen formed and a bank account has been opened, the corrupt employee begins\nbilling his employer. Invoices can be easily generated on a personal computer.\nFalse invoices do not have to be of professional quality to generate fraudulent\ndisbursements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Self-Approval of\nFraudulent Invoices--&nbsp; The difficulty in\na shell company scheme is not usually in producing the invoices, but in getting\nthe victim organisation to pay them. Authorisation for the fictitious purchase\n(and therefore payment of the bill) is the key. In a large percentage of shell\ncompany cases, the perpetrator is in a position to approve payment on the very\ninvoices he is fraudulently submitting. The duties of preparing and approving\nvouchers should be separated to avoid this kind of scheme.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In companies where a\nproper separation of duties exists, the employee with approval authority\nsometimes creates fraudulent vouchers or purchase orders and forges the\nsignature of the person who is in charge of preparing these documents. Then the\nperpetrator approves payment on the fraudulent vouchers he has generated. This\nmakes it appear that two employees have signed off on the voucher as mandated\nby the victim organisation\u2019s controls.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not all companies\nrequire the completion of payment vouchers before they will issue cheques. In some\nenterprises, cheques are written based on less formal procedures, such as the\nsubmission of \u201ccheque requests.\u201d These requests simply list the payee\u2019s name,\nthe amount to be paid, and a brief narrative stating the reason for the cheque.\nObviously, this is not a very sound procedure for preventing fraud. Dishonest\nemployees have little trouble running shell company schemes in organisations\nthat operate this way.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negligent Supervisors---&nbsp; If an employee cannot authorise payments\nhimself, the next best thing is if the person who has that authority is\ninattentive or overly trusting. Negligent supervisors are often targeted by\nunethical employees. In some cases, supervisors are attentive to the purchase\norders they are asked to authorise, but they lack the technical knowledge to\nspot fraud as it is happening.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For instance, a manager\nor administrator might not completely understand the costs associated with\nupgrading computer software to modernise a work area. This manager will have to\nrely on his subordinates who have the necessary technical expertise to\ndetermine that costs are being kept in line. The subordinates might be able to\ntake advantage of this situation to cause the company to overpay for the\nequipment required to upgrade the system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reliance on False\nDocuments--When an employee does not have approval authority for purchases and\ndoes not have the benefit of a negligent supervisor, he must run his vouchers\nthrough the normal accounts payable process. The success of this kind of scheme\ndepends on the apparent authenticity of the false voucher he creates. If the\nperpetrator can generate purchase orders and receiving reports that corroborate\nthe information on the fraudulent invoice from his shell company, he can fool\naccounts payable into issuing a cheque.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Collusion---Collusion\nis a type of fraud where two or more individuals agree to commit an act\ndesigned to deceive or gain an unfair advantage. Collusion among several\nemployees is sometimes used to overcome well-designed internal controls. For\nexample, in a company with proper separation of duties, the functions of\npurchasing goods or services, authorising the purchase, receiving the goods or\nservices, and making the payment to the vendor should all be separated. If this\nprocess is strictly adhered to, it will be extremely difficult for any single\nemployee to commit a false-billing scheme. But if several employees work\ntogether, they can overcome the internal controls of their employer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EXAMPLE:-&nbsp;&nbsp; A warehouse foreman and a parts-ordering\nclerk conspired to purchase approximately $300,000 worth of nonexistent\nsupplies. The clerk initiated the false transactions by obtaining approval to\nplace orders for parts he claimed were needed. The orders were then sent to a\nvendor who, acting in conjunction with the two employee fraudsters, prepared\nfalse invoices that were sent to the victim company. Meanwhile, the warehouse\nforeman verified receipt of the fictitious shipments of incoming supplies. The\nperpetrators were therefore able to compile complete vouchers for the\nfraudulent purchases without overstepping their normal duties.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even if all internal\ncontrols are observed, at some point a company must rely on its employees to be\nhonest. One of the purposes of separating duties is to prevent any one person\nfrom having too much control over a particular business function. It provides a\nbuilt- in monitoring mechanism where every person\u2019s actions are in some way\nverified by another person. But if everyone is corrupt, even proper controls\ncannot prevent fraud.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purchases of Services\nRather than Goods--&nbsp; Most shell company\nschemes involve the purchase of services rather than goods. The primary reason\nfor this is that services are not tangible. If an employee sets up a shell\ncompany to make fictitious sales of goods to his employer, these goods will\nobviously never arrive. By comparing its purchases to its inventory levels, the\nvictim organisation might detect the fraud. It is much more difficult for the\nvictim organisation to verify that the services were never rendered. For this\nreason, many employees involved in shell company schemes bill their employers\nfor things like \u201cconsulting services.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pass-Through Schemes---&nbsp; In most shell company schemes, victim\norganisations are billed for completely fictitious purchases of goods or\nservices. However, there is a subcategory of shell company schemes in which\nactual goods or services are sold to the victim company. These are known as\npass- through schemes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pass-through schemes\nare usually undertaken by employees in charge of purchasing on the victim\ncompany\u2019s behalf. Instead of buying merchandise directly from a vendor, the\nemployee sets up a shell company and purchases the merchandise through that\nfictitious entity. He then resells the merchandise to his employer from the\nshell company at an inflated price.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EXAMPLE:&nbsp;&nbsp; A department director was put in charge of\npurchasing computer equipment. Because of his expertise on the subject and his\nhigh standing within the company, he was unsupervised in this task. The\ndirector set up a shell company in another province and bought used computers\nthrough the shell company, and then turned around and sold them to his employer\nat a greatly exaggerated price. The money from the victim company\u2019s first\ninstallment on the computers was used to pay the shell company\u2019s debts to the\nreal vendors. Subsequent payments were profits for the bogus company. The\nscheme cost the victim company more than $1 million.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A CRIMINALS MIND<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Forming a shell entity\nfor illegal purposes\u2026<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">---Obtain a P.O. Box\nwith post office for company address<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--- Open bank account\nat local bank in business name with state filed documents<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--- Obtain a pre-paid\ncell phone to use as business phone (Cell phone carriers do not check&nbsp; background information nor verify names for\npre-paid purchases and services)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- Have some\ninexpensive business cards made to allude that the business is legitimate; use\nonly the name of the business, a P.O. box, and a phone number (no contact name,\nno logo, and no e-mail address)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- Submit invoices to\ncorporate accounts payable function for professional services<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--- Receive payments\nfor professional services invoices and deposit the funds into a business bank\naccount<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- After the checks\nclear or based on some external event, close the business bank account,\ndiscontinue the pre-paid cell phone number from service, and close the P.O. box\nthat you had originally set up for mailing purposes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--- Destroy any and all\npaperwork associated with the professional services&nbsp; company<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Victims in the US were\nthreatened with tax investigation by call centre executives of these firms\npretending to be officials from the IRS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Financial records of a\nstring of companies, being investigated by Thane police for running call\ncentres that allegedly duped over 6,500 US citizens of at least Rs 500 crore,\nhave uncovered shell companies with a capital of just Rs 1 lakh, and little\ndisclosure or mandatory filings of financial and company-related details after\nincorporation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Thane police are\ninvestigating at least five firms \u2014 Iserve BPO Pvt Ltd, Lorex Impex Pvt Ltd,\nMAC Outsourcing Services, Tech Solutions and Call-Tech Solutions \u2014 behind the\nInternal Revenue Service (IRS) telephone impersonation scam through little\nknown call centres from Mira Road in Thane district.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A detailed look at the\nofficial filings of at least three companies\u2014 IServe BPO, Lorex Impex and MAC\nOutsourcing Services \u2014 accessed by The Sunday Express through the Registrar of\nCompanies (RoC), reveals a common pattern of non-disclosure of statutory\ndocuments such as annual financial reports, profit and loss statements, and\nboard resolutions of the firms since their incorporation in 2012.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The three\ncompanies have a paid-up capital and authorised share capital of Rs 1 lakh\neach.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under the Companies Act\n2013, a company and its officials can be penalised with a fine of at least Rs\n50,000 or imprisonment of up to six months for not filing the annual report\nwith the RoC within 330 days of its annual general meeting.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To escape tax\ninvestigation, many Americans agreed to pay between $500 and $60,000 in gift\ncards and iTunes gift cards. The call centres were allegedly making Rs 1.5\ncrore daily in this manner for over a year. Police have now booked as many as\n700 people associated with these calls centres on charges of cheating,\nextortion and impersonation under the Indian Penal Code and other relevant\nlaws.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><a href=\"http://indianexpress.com/article/india/post-thane-call-centre-bust-india-may-be-emerging-as-a-major-centre-for-fraud-report-4458475/\">http://indianexpress.com/article/india/post-thane-call-centre-bust-india-may-be-emerging-as-a-major-centre-for-fraud-report-4458475/</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<div>\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Special Investigation\nTeam (SIT) on black money recommended proactive mining of RoC company database\nby government\u2019s fraud office to weed out shell companies. This, after the SIT\nfound shell companies were used to provide accommodation entries to launder\nblack money in several high profile cases investigated in the recent past.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Books of shell\ncompanies are well maintained. They have their accounts audited, tax returns\nfiled regularly and a functioning bank account.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In most cases, directors and\nshareholders are unrelated persons and often untraceable. Except their\nidentities, they have no direct stake.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>THANK GOD INDIA WAS INVADED-- SUHEL SETH</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">WE WANT THESE NDTV BASTARDS TO GO TO JAIL !</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2kT21GX_HTk/WL63LeIFoTI/AAAAAAABRic/rbXmnDNu068IB_6kehm41AsBmU6eTLy5gCLcB/s1600/SEBI-Discldddosures-page-001.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yesterday NDTV on\nMonday admitted its illegalities and wrongs committed including insider trading\nand decided to settle the cases by adjudication and withdrawing frivolous\nappeals and counter cases related to violation of Stock Exchange norms.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\nadmission of guilt is informed to Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and National\nStock Exchange (NSE) on a letter dated March 6 by NDTV.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This letter to Stock\nExchanges is a clear admission of guilt by the TV channel and invites the\nprovisions of registering cases under Prevention of Money Laundering Act\n(PMLA). A few days ago, NDTV received a big setback as the RBI rejected their\nmove to compound the FEMA Notice of Rs.2030 crore.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apart from these huge\nfines involving serious financial implications, NDTV has been slapped Rs.525\ncrores ($78.8 million) fine by Income Tax. These developments will block\nPrannoy Roy\u2019s attempt to sell the channel, as Income Tax has already blocked\nthe sale of his and wife\u2019s shares. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">PRANNOY JAMES ROYs (\nUNCLE OF NAXAL LOVER ARUNDHATI SUZANNE ROY ) AND HIS WIFEs RADHIKA ROY (\nCOMMIE &nbsp;BRINDA KARATs SISTER )---</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">--- MUST NOT\nBE ALLOWED TO FLEE THE COUNTRY LIKE VIJAYA MALLYA AND SANJAY BHANDARI.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IF THE INDIAN GOVT OR &nbsp;SECURITY AGENCIES NOT KNOW THEIR FOREIGN\nASSESTS \u2013ASK ANY RICH INDIAN &nbsp;IN SOUTH\nAFRICA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bMyfA0kwSsc/WL64yTjvNSI/AAAAAAABRik/25WgiqVe748rvgxDe9XAjVYeCTDYMpbywCLcB/s1600/imagDes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"226\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bMyfA0kwSsc/WL64yTjvNSI/AAAAAAABRik/25WgiqVe748rvgxDe9XAjVYeCTDYMpbywCLcB/s400/imagDes.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the 1980s, the Bank\nof Credit and Commerce International, an international bank founded by a\nPakistani financier, was found to have been involved in wide-scale money\nlaundering and other illegal financial dealings. clandestine division of the\nbank called the \"black network,\" which functions as a global\nintelligence operation and a Mafia-like enforcement squad.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Operating primarily\nout of the bank's offices in Karachi, Pakistan, the 1,500-employee black\nnetwork has used sophisticated spy equipment and techniques, along with\nbribery, extortion, kidnapping and even, by some accounts, murder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The more conventional\ndepartments of B.C.C.I. handled such services as laundering money for the drug\ntrade and helping dictators loot their national treasuries. B.C.C.I. was\nstarted in 1972 with the putative mission of becoming the Muslim world's first\nbanking powerhouse. This Islamic thing was a mere front BCCI was a Jewish bank.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though it was\nincorporated in Luxembourg and headquartered in London, had more than 400\nbranches and subsidiaries around the world and was nominally owned by Arab\nshareholders from the gulf countries, B.C.C.I. was always a Pakistani bank, with\nits heart in Karachi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BCCI's criminality included fraud by BCCI and BCCI customers involving\nbillions of dollars; money laundering in Europe, Africa, Asia, and the\nAmericas; BCCI's bribery of officials in most of those locations; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BCCI survived for two decades\nbecause it floated on the waves of the offshore system, with key booking\noperations in Luxembourg and the Cayman Islands, where bank regulators couldn\u2019t\ngo. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A decade after opening, BCCI had over 400\nbranches in 78 countries, and assets in excess of US$20 billion, making it the\n7th largest private bank in the world.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As losses mounted,(\nmney siphoned off by Jews ) &nbsp;the BCCI\nbank apparently hatched a scheme to cover them up by making interest payments\non loans with deposits from other customers. The idea was to deceive auditors\nfrom detecting the red ink in its loan portfolio.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The scheme also involved\noffshore funds parked in lightly regulated countries that could be drawn down\nto patch up losses elsewhere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And when capital was\nneeded to absorb further losses, the bank artificially pumped up its share\nprice by lending money to existing shareholders to buy more stock. The proceeds\nfrom the stock would help balance the bank's books, but actually the bank was\nmerely taking depositor money and investing it in the bank.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bankers, regulators and\neven some law-enforcement officials had only vague notions for years that the\nBCC Group S.A., the holding company for B.C.C.I. and its affiliates, was a\nstrange and shadowy institution.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since the early 1980's, the company's\nreputation made banking officials uneasy -- a \"stateless\" bank that\noperated in the United States and about 70 other countries, chartered in\nLuxembourg, run by Pakistanis, owned by Arabs, headquartered in Britain and\nserviced by outposts in the Cayman Islands, a well-known haven for private\nbanking\u2014all shadow managed by Jews.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; More than 15% of the U.S. live in poverty. Donald Trump is trying to do something, but Jew Rothschild traitor commies will NOT allow him\u2026<br />\n<br />\nCHINAs ECONOMY IS A BUBBLE WITH A BUBBLE \u2013 CREATED BY MAD MEN.<br />\n<br />\nChnia's debt-to-GDP ratio has soared from 148 % to more than 301 % over a decade, the kind of surge that is usually followed by an abrupt slowdown.<br />\n<br />\nA big percentage of the new debt is swallowed by interest on existing loans<br />\n<br />\nA big percentage of biggest Chinese firms owed more in interest than they earned before tax.<br />\n<br />\nChina requires more and more credit to generate less and less growth.<br />\n<br />\nChina is now the world\u2019s largest economy; its banking sector is the biggest, with assets equivalent to 41% of global GDP ( on paper )<br />\n<br />\nChina has spent more than y $262 billion to prop up the stockmarket; $73 billion of bank loans have gone bad; financial frauds have cost investors more than $27 billion; and $805 billion of capital has left the country.<br />\n<br />\nTo help pump up growth, officials have inflated a property bubble. Debt is still expanding more than twice as fast as the economy.<br />\n<br />\nChina has a huge shadow banking sector.<br />\n<br />\nShadow banking, a term for financial agents that perform bank-like activity but are not regulated as banks---a way of circumventing government's tight controls on lending.<br />\n<br />\nChina has not even understood how SHELL COMPANIES are ruining their nation<br />\n<br />\nShadow financing is often called \u201cbank loans in disguise,\u201d because a bank is often at the core of the transaction, for example, offering an implicit guarantee for the various wealth products it sells to the non-banks it engages with.<br />\n<br />\nChina\u2019s shadow financing is about 36% of GDP .<br />\n<br />\nChina Jan FX reserves fall below $3 trillion for first time in nearly 7 years.. While China quickly downplayed the fall below the $3 trillion level, the breach could bolster China's argument that it not deliberately devaluing its currency.<br />\n<br />\nWhile the world's second-largest economy still has the largest stash of forex reserves by far, it has burned through over half a trillion dollars since August 2015, when it stunned global investors by devaluing the yuan.<br />\n<br />\nCHINESE SLIT EYED VIEW :: Large stockpiles of reserves is not the benefit to the economy that many assume, since it results in too much Chinese currency (which the reserves have to be converted into) sloshing around, creating inflation. Falling through the $3 trillion mark - which was the level they should not fall below - does not carry that much significance<br />\n<br />\nTEE HEEE !<br />\n<br />\nCapt Ajit Vadakayil says --- puruse criteria relating to levels of exports, money supply and debt, China should hold a minimum of $2.6 trillion of foreign exchange reserves.<br />\n<br />\nG7 NATIONS ARE ALL BEGGAR NATIONS ..
